item.title: Java , is it worth it to
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I’d just like to point out that just because you use one file doesn’t mean you are only using one class, you can still use anonymous classes, and even private named classes. You still might run into issues as sun’s javac only accepts files with a max of lines and/or characters, I don’t remember the limit, I think it might be 10,000 lines or something.

In short, no, there is no reason to only use 1 file.

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“IlikeArrays, post:8, topic:386737”]It is basic organization… If you look at a counter full of books… would you rather look at 12 different books (split into different categories like math, spanish, french, science) or do you want to look through one book for the thing you need?

The performance difference (if there is one) will not be noticed.[/quote]
Not entirely sure if I would have used Books in the analogy, but possibly a GUI involving tabs, or a scroll bar. Books, depending on the thickness, can slow you down when looking for a specific thing. Tabs on a GUI, or even a scroll bar don’t do much of a difference.
